clinical_study.brief_title: Clopidogrel Response Evaluation and AnTi-Platelet InterVEntion in High Thrombotic Risk PCI Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Investigator Initiated Prospective Study to Investigate the Best Anti-platelet Treatment in High Thrombotic Risk PCI Patients.

lead_sponsor.agency: Chinese Academy of Medical Sciences, Fuwai Hospital

clinical_study.source: Chinese Academy of Medical Sciences, Fuwai Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: To identify the high-risk patients who might have in-stent thrombosis after PCI with thromboelastography and to head-to-head compare two intensified antiplatelet therapeutic strategies of double-dosage Clopidogrel and triple antiplatelet therapy with Cilostazol with the standard antiplatelet therapy.

detailed_description.textblock: Study population: Age 18 - 75, male or non-pregnant female; stable or unstable angina with evidence of myocardial ischemia, or patient with myocardial infarction; coronary angiography reveals stenosis lesions; discovery of ADP induced platelet inhibition rate < 50% and MAADP > 47mm via thromboelastography (indicating low responsiveness to Clopidogrel with high risk for stent thrombosis formation); is able to understand the objective of the trial, takes part voluntarily and signs the written informed consent form.

primary_outcome.measure: Major adverse cardiac and cerebrovascular events
primary_outcome.description: MACCE, including cardiac death, myocardial infarction, target vessel revascularization and cerebrovascular events

secondary_outcome.description: to evaluate with Seattle Angina Scale

arm_group.description: A Standard antiplatelet therapy control group： Clopidogrel 75mg Qd + Aspirin 100mg Qd
B Double-dosage Clopidogrel group： Clopidogrel 150mg Qd + Aspirin 100mg Qd
C triple antiplatelet therapy group： Cilostazol 100mg Bid + Aspirin 100mg Qd + Clopidogrel 75mg Qd

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Chinese Academy of Medical Sciences, Fuwai Hospital
